isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - OPERATION - DIGITAL ODOMETER/HOURMETER DISPLAY (OPTIONAL)

svcprocinfo.para: This feature is an internal part of the Speedometer/Tachometer module. It displays miles, trip miles, engine hours and trip engine hours. The user may step through the modes by depressing the momentary switch located by the speedometer gauge bezel. The name of the parameter being displayed changes as the switch is depressed. Trip hours and trip miles may be cleared by depressing the button for three seconds.

The display module may be replaced by the user. The data for the display is stored in Speedometer/Tachometer module microprocessor memory. After replacing the display, the module provides the previous mileage and engine hour data. Replacing the Speedometer/Tachometer module will provide zeroed values for all odometer functions.

svcsubproc.title: Battery Voltage To Speedometer/Tachometer Module
svcsubproc.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module receives battery voltage (key ON or OFF) from 15A fuse F5-C. This voltage is only necessary with modules having the digital display unit. When the key is turned OFF, the battery voltage is needed only for the next few seconds for the Speedometer/Tachometer module to save the odometer/hourmeter data in memory. Other than those couple of seconds, if the batteries are disconnected, it will not affect the Speedometer/Tachometer module.
